title: Augusta County: L. Luckett to Alexander H. H. Stuart, September 2, 1861
summary: Luckett describes the "long tedious" trip back to Louisiana from Virginia. He reports his crops are in good condition, and describes war prepartions for the coming conflict of "Saxon against Norman, the Puritan & Cavalier."
keywords: Family, Troop Movement, Agriculture, Patriotism, Home Front, Slavery, Women, American Civil War
